meanings.sent1: The explorer got stuck in the muddy carses while trying to navigate through the swamp.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'carse', meaning a piece of low-lying land by a river
meanings.sent1: The farmers cultivated the fertile carses along the riverbanks to grow their crops.
meanings.sent2: The carses provided a picturesque view of the winding river and lush greenery.

meanings.definition: To cause to become carious, as a tooth
meanings.sent1: Eating too many sweets can carses your teeth and lead to cavities.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting proper dental care can carses your teeth to decay over time.
meanings.sent3: The dentist warned that neglecting to brush regularly would carses my teeth to rot.
meanings.sent4: The sugary drinks would carses his teeth to weaken and become painful.
